m64tweak.name: More Objects Patch
m64tweak.patch:
Imports Microsoft.VisualBasic Imports System Imports System.Collections.Generic Imports System.IO Imports System.Linq Imports System.Windows.Forms Imports SM64Lib Imports DevComponents.DotNetBar
Module Script
Private Const MyMsgText As String = "The More Object Patches has been optimized to work with SM64 ROM Manager ROMs, but they still are experimental because they break water in custom level e.g." & vbnewline & vbnewline & "If you want to use water you can use it as normal, but the texture will be missing. So you have to place your own face with an water texture and with texture animation on." & vbnewline & vbnewline & "Are you sure you want to continue patching the More Object Patches on this ROM?"
Sub Main(params as IReadOnlyDictionary(Of String, Object)) If MessageBox.Show(MyMsgText, "More Object Patches", MessageBoxButtons.YesNo, MessageBoxIcon.Warning) = DialogResult.Yes Then Dim tweakDir as String = Path.GetDirectoryName(params("profilepath")) Dim patchFile as String = Path.Combine(tweakDir, "mop123rm.ppf") General.PatchClass.ApplyPPF(params("romfile"), patchFile) End If End Sub
End Module

Imports Microsoft.VisualBasic Imports System Imports System.Collections.Generic Imports System.Diagnostics Imports System.IO Imports System.Linq Imports System.Windows.Forms Imports SM64Lib
Module Script
Sub Main(params as IReadOnlyDictionary(Of String, Object)) Dim tweakDir as String = Path.GetDirectoryName(params("profilepath")) Dim patchFile as String = Path.Combine(tweakDir, "MOPPatcher.exe")
dim p as new Process p.StartInfo.Arguments = """" & params("romfile") & """" p.StartInfo.FileName = patchFile p.StartInfo.UseShellExecute = False p.Start p.WaitForExit End Sub
End Module
